Podarcis filfolensis is a diurnal, insectivorous species, feeding primarily on small invertebrates such as insects, spiders, and other arthropods. It is well-adapted to the dry, rocky habitat of the Filfla island, where it can be found basking on the cliffs and crevices.

The Filfola wall lizard is considered a vulnerable species due to its limited distribution and the potential threats posed by human disturbance and invasive species. Conservation efforts are in place to protect this unique island endemic and its fragile ecosystem.
